snippet: In winning the Tata Steel tournament, Magnus Carlsen increased his rating to 2,872 points, the highest in history and better than his previous record-setting number.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column notes number one-ranked player Magnus Carlsen, In winning the Tata Steel tournament, increased his rating to 2,872 points, the highest in history and better than his previous record-setting number.
lead_paragraph: In winning the Tata Steel tournament, Magnus Carlsen increased his rating to 2,872 points, the highest in history and better than his previous record-setting number.

headline.seo: Chess: Carlsen Breaks His Own Ratings Record
headline.main: The World’s No. 1 Player Breaks His Own Record
headline.print_headline: The World’s No. 1 Player Breaks His Own Record
